section.title: Introduction to Sudoku

li.p: You will learn how to play Sudoku.
You will learn the basic strategies for placing numbers in the grid without guessing.

section.observation: What is your experience with logic puzzles?
section.p: Sudoku is a classic pen-and-paper puzzle. (A pen-and-paper puzzle is a puzzle that can be given to you on paper and solved using just a pen and your brain.) If you look around, you will be able to find all sorts of puzzle books that contain them, as well as dozens of websites or apps that let you access gigantic libraries of puzzles.

The standard Sudoku grid is a 9x9 square grid that has been broken up into 9 3x3 boxes. A valid Sudoku grid is one in which every square in the grid is filled with one of the digits from 1 to 9 subject to the condition that each digit appears in every row, column, and box exactly once. The diagram below shows a valid Sudoku grid.
A typical puzzle starts with only some of the squares filled with digits, and it is up to the player to fill in the remaining digits to get a valid Sudoku grid.
